meanings.definition: The worship or idolization of William Shakespeare.
meanings.sent1: In the small town, the bardolatries gathered every year to celebrate Shakespeare's birthday.
meanings.sent2: Her bardolatries were evident in the way she quoted Shakespeare in every conversation.
meanings.sent3: The bardolatries at the Shakespeare festival wore costumes from his plays.
meanings.sent4: His bardolatries shone through when he visited Shakespeare's birthplace in Stratford-upon-Avon.
meanings.sent5: The bardolatries of the students were clear as they enthusiastically acted out scenes from Romeo and Juliet.

meanings.definition: Excessive admiration or devotion to Shakespeare's works.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's bardolatries for Shakespeare influenced her students to appreciate his plays.
meanings.sent2: His bardolatries led him to collect rare editions of Shakespeare's works.
meanings.sent3: The bardolatries of the book club members were evident as they discussed Shakespeare's sonnets for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her bardolatries reached new heights when she traveled to England to see where Shakespeare wrote his plays.
meanings.sent5: The bardolatries of the audience were palpable as they gave a standing ovation after the Shakespearean play.
